intro: Leucadendron decorum, commonly known as the silver coin bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking, cone-shaped inflorescences that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant has finely divided, silver-gray leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its showy flowers and drought tolerance. Leucadendron decorum prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
